text: Amber coloured and hazy. Has a white head, medium duration. Aroma is mainly malty, Notes of dark bread, moderate bitter finish.

1L plastic bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Herbal. Moderate bitter flavor. Some herbs and caramel. Dry and woody. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, bready and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 130416

Bottle @ Johns. Pours dark golden with an small offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, sweet ripe fruit, red apples. Flavor is light sweet, light malt, yeast, hay, sweet ripe fruit, apples. Medium body, lively carbonation, light sweet finish. 130416

Plastic bottle, 4.9%. Slightly hazy amber with small off/white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, caramel, little bread and grass. Flavour is malt, caramel, bread, sweet, hops, grass, grainy, herbal, notes of chocolate, medium sweet and a little bitter.
Plastic bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, malt, grass and hops. Nice bitter finish.

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Nota Bene (Prague, République-Tchèque). Arôme: Odeur de céréale grillée. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréale grillée avec une pointe de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de caramel en arrière goût. (Rating #4897)
On tap at Nota Bene. Pours mostly clear amber with tan head. Aroma is yeasty, caramel, malt, hint of some fruits. Flavor is malt, butter, caramel, yeast.

On tap, second trip to Nota Bene. Nice clear copper-bronze pour with beautiful head. Elegant roasted grain aroma, light caramel notes, burnt caramel, candied sugar, very clean no yeast, no fruity fermentation notes. Nice toasted grain flavour, again very clean. light caramel sweetness. Dry palate, medium carbonation, on the high side for the style. No difficulty identifying this polotmave as a fine representative of what the style is and should be.

My Bottom Line:
This silky Polotmavé shares a beautifully-defined caramel malt and herbal hop profile from aroma to finish .

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy head of foam stays atop the shiny dark-amber copper.
-Mouthfeel is rather lean, yet not dry.
-The herbal hop bitterness leaves enough room for the malts the shine even in the aftertaste.
-Everything is harmonious and well-rendered : this is a quintessential Polotmavé.

On tap at Nota Bene, Praha.

Pours in dark ruby with no head at all. The aroma is malty, little bit yeasty with some earthiness. Taste is quite sweet, too much for my taste of this style. Some smokiness in the background, well balanced. Body is flat, almost no carbonation. Good bye Mr. Havel. ;)
